intro: Margyricarpus imberbis, commonly known as the naked-fruited margyricarpus, is a rare and enigmatic plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a short, erect stem and lanceolate leaves with a smooth, glabrous surface. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in complex inflorescences. Its fruits are distinctive for their lack of covering structures, giving it the common name "naked-fruited." Due to its limited geographic distribution and specialized habitat requirements, Margyricarpus imberbis is considered a rare and endangered species.
